snippet.title: What Every Parent Should Know About Standardized Testing
snippet.description: If your child is constantly sharpening up those No. 2 pencils, you may want to ask your child's teacher for a meeting and find out just what those test scores really mean.

snippet.title: Teaching to the Test: Part One
snippet.description: Okay, so I did promise to open the can of worms on teaching to the test. Before I get going, let me first define what exactly that means, and then in the next post (Part Two) I will clarify which tests I am talking abou...

snippet.title: Kim: Teaching Kaitlyn to Test
snippet.description: Just like getting dressed, brushing her teeth and tying her shoes, testing her blood sugar is something that my daughter, who has type 1 diabetes, will need to get used to!

snippet.title: Rewards for High Test Scores?
snippet.description: Recently, I read that the whole over-emphasis on standardized test scores has been taken to a new level. It seems officials in the San Marcos, California, school district want to reward students who score high on the an...

snippet.title: Teaching to the Test: Part Two
snippet.description: I made the point in my last posting that teaching to the test in and of itself is not such a bad thing. This brings me to my second point on this topic: which type of test? It gets dicey when teachers are required by th...

snippet.title: Student Test Scores and NCLB
snippet.description: In a new report released this week by the Center on Education Policy, student state test scores were found to have increased in the last 5 years.Though this report has several things going for it, like many other studie...

snippet.title: Video/DVD Review: Thomas & Friends: Hero of the Rails
snippet.description: Typical Thomas tale with mild peril; fun for fans.
